intro: Tithymalus davisii, commonly known as the Davis' tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to specific regions in North America, particularly in the southwestern United States. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
